name: COVID-19 doses donations to COVAX announced, per doses used
descriptionShort: Number of COVID-19 doses that have been announced as donations by countries to COVAX. These doses have not yet been donated to COVAX, per dose administered domestically.
descriptionKey: COVAX is an international initiative led by Gavi, CEPI, and WHO to ensure equitable access to COVID-19 vaccines, regardless of a country's wealth.
Through the COVAX Facility, self-financing countries pool funds to procure vaccines, while 92 lower-income countries receive free doses supported by donor funding through the Gavi COVAX AMC.
Donations to COVAX help scale up vaccine manufacturing capacity early, preventing significant delays or shortages once vaccines receive approval.
Ensuring widespread vaccine access underpins the 'no one is safe until everyone is safe' principle, aiming to end the pandemic by reducing disparities in vaccination.

origins.title: Vaccine dose donations to COVAX
origins.description:
A global effort to help developing countries access and deliver COVID-19 vaccines, testing, and therapeutics, as they work to end the pandemic and boost economic recovery.

The International Monetary Fund, World Bank Group, World Health Organization and World Trade Organization have joined forces to accelerate access to COVID-19 vaccines, therapeutics and diagnostics by leveraging multilateral finance and trade solutions, particularly in low- and middle-income countries.

Through this web site, which includes a global database and country-by-country data dashboards, the Task Force is tracking and monitoring specific global and country-level gaps to support faster and more targeted solutions to accelerate access to COVID-19 vaccines, treatments and tests in developing countries.
origins.citationFull: Multilateral Leaders Task Force on COVID-19. A joint initiative from the International Monetary Fund, World Bank, World Health Organization, and World Trade Organization). March 2022.
